p: Our results also suggest that the ratio α/ β can be used to identify patients who are likely to benefit from dose reduction. We predict that patients with α/ β>15 are very likely to retain the original long-term treatment efficiency after a 50% dose reduction ( Online Supplementary Figure S7B and C). Furthermore, we derived a condition to identify patients who do not obtain sufficient TKI dose initially. Specifically, we found that patients with slopes α/ β<2 would benefit from dose escalation, while only patients with α/ β≫2 benefit from dose de-escalation ( Online Supplementary Figure S8).
